IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: PROMOTE, SPONSOR, AND IMPLEMENT RESEARCH AND SERVICE ACTIVITIES IN FOREIGN COUNTRIES, INCLUDING SPECIALIZATION IN INTERNATIONAL LEGAL, ECONOMIC, POLITICAL, AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE.
IRS990.MissionDescription: PROMOTE, SPONSOR, AND IMPLEMENT RESEARCH AND SERVICE ACTIVITIES IN FOREIGN COUNTRIES, INCLUDING SPECIALIZATION IN INTERNATIONAL LEGAL, ECONOMIC, POLITICAL, AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
IRS990.Description: COMMERCIAL, LEGAL, AND INSTITUTIONAL REFORM:MULTIPLE PROJECTS SPONSORED BY US AGENCY FOR INTERNATIONAL DEVELOPMENT. PROVIDE ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT INFORMATION TO THIRD WORLD AND FORMER SOVIET UNION BLOCK COUNTRIES. PROVIDE CAPACITY BUILDING AND CURRICULUM DEVELOPMENT IN CONSTRUCTIVE CONFLICT MANAGEMENT, PREVENTION, AND PEACE BUILDING IN RESPECTIVE NATIONS.

Activity2.Description: ASSESS IMPACT OF INNOVATION GRANTS IN FINANCIAL SERVICES:ASSISTING THE GATES FOUNDATION IN ASSESSING THE IMPACT OF ITS GRANTS TO MICROFINANCE ORGANIZATIONS. THE PROJECT WILL UTILIZE THE MOST ADVANCED QUANTITATIVE AND QUALITATIVE MEASUREMENT METHODOLOGIES TO DETERMINE HOW FINANCIAL SERVICES FOR THE POOR CONTRIBUTE TO THE REDUCTION OF INEQUITY AND POVERTY AND THE ACHIEVEMENT OF SUSTAINABLE AND SCALABLE PROVISION OF SERVICES.

Activity3.Description: DEVELOPING POVERTY ASSESSMENT TOOLS II (PAT II) / FINANCIAL INTEGRATION, ECONOMIC LEVERAGING, BROAD-BASED DISSEMINATION AND SUPPORT (FIELD PROGRAMS):DEVELOP LOW COST TOOLS TO ACCURATELY ASSESS POVERTY LEVELS OF CLIENTS IN USAID SPONSORED MICROENTERPRISE PROGRAMS (PAT II). PROCURE RESEARCH AND TECHNICAL SERVICES FROM A CONSORTIUM OF PARTNERS (FIELD CORE). IMPLEMENT A STRATEGIC LEARNING INITIATIVE STUDYING THE EFFECT ON FOOD SECURITY THROUGH COMMUNITY BASED EFFORTS (FIELD/LWA).

ActivityOther.Description: INSTABILITY, CRISIS, AND RECOVERY PROGRAMS - ICRP ALERT LISTS / EARLY WARNING ALERTS
LAW MAPPING STUDY - WOMEN'S RIGHTS IN EAST & HORN OF AFRICA
MCC BURKINA FASO - EVALUATION OF ACTIVITIES TO INCREASE INVESTMENT IN LAND AND RURAL PRODUCTIVITY WITH THE GOAL OF INCREASED VOLUME AND VALUE OF AGRICULTURAL PRODUCTION
IMPACT OF DEMOCRACY AND GOVERNANCE REFORMS IN COLUMBIA
TIME HORIZONS - GENERATE TOOLS AND METHODS TO MEASURE INTERVENTIONS THAT AIM TO MITIGATE POVERTY AND CONFLICT IN FRAGILE ENVIRONMENTS
ASSESS IMPACT OF PUBLIC DISCLOSURE ON POLLUTION ABATEMENT INITIATIVES (EGYPT) / MICROFINANCE REGULATION & SUPERVISION RESOURCE CENTER II

AddressUS.AddressLine1: RM 4101G CHESAPEAKE BLD U OF MD

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: IN JUNE 2006, A NEW FINANCIAL AND REPORTING STANDARD ADDRESSING ACCOUNTING FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES WAS ISSUED. THE NEW STANDARD REQUIRES AN ENTITY TO RECOGNIZE THE FINANCIAL STATEMENT IMPACT OF A TAX POSITION WHEN IT IS MORE-LIKELY-THAN-NOT THAT THE POSITION WILL BE SUSTAINED UPON EXAMINATION. THE NEW STANDARD BECAME EFFECTIVE FOR THE ORGANIZATION'S 2010 FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, AND THE EFFECT OF ITS ADOPTION WAS NOT MATERIAL TO THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: GRANT IS PROVIDED TO THE RELATED ORGANIZATION. GRANT IS FOR OPERATING SUPPORT AND THEREFORE NO ADDITIONAL MONITORING IS DEEMED NECESSARY.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: SCH J, PART I, LINE 3: ALL COMPENSATION IS ESTABLISHED BY THE UNIVERSITY OF MARYLAND BASED UPON THE POLICIES AND PROCEDURES ESTABLISHED BY THE UNIVERSITY. THE UNIVERSITY OF MARYLAND NEGOTIATES AN EMPLOYMENT CONTRACT WITH THE PRESIDENT. THE CONTRACT MUST BE APPROVED BY THE UNIVERSITY'S BOARD OF REGENTS AND MUST BE REVIEWED BY THE MARYLAND OFFICE OF THE ATTORNEY GENERAL.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 1
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS DELEGATES AUTHORITY TO AN EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE WHICH EXERCISES THE POWERS VESTED IN THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS BETWEEN BOARD MEETINGS. THE COMMITTEE IS COMPRISED OF THE CHAIRMAN OF THE BOARD, THE PRESIDENT OF THE CORPORATION, THE VICE PRESIDENTS OF THE IRIS CENTER AND THE VICE PRESIDENTS OF THE CORPORATION. ALL EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE MEMBERS ARE MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 3
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE UNIVERSITY RESEARCH CORPORATION INTERNATIONAL (URCI) HAS ENTERED INTO A MANAGEMENT AGREEMENT WITH THE RELATED PARTY TO PROCESS URCI'S FINANCIAL INFORMATION.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: A DRAFT IS REVIEWED BY THE ACCOUNTANT AND THEN SECOND REVIEWED BY THE CORPORATE CONTROLLER WHO ENDORSES THE DRAFT. THE BOARD RECEIVES A FINAL VERSION OF THE RETURN AFTER IT IS FILED. HOWEVER, THE CHAIRMAN OF THE BOARD RECEIVES A FULLY ENDORSED VERSION AS PART OF THE ANNUAL COMPLIANCE REPORTING REQUIREMENTS TO THE UNIVERSITY BOARD OF REGENTS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: URCI/IRIS PERSONNEL ARE REQUIRED TO FOLLOW ALL UNIVERSITY OF MARYLAND, A RELATED PARTY, POLICIES AND PROCEDURES. THE UNIVERSITY OF MARYLAND POLICY ON CONFLICT OF INTEREST/CONFLICT OF COMMITMENT REQUIRES THAT ALL FULL-TIME FACULTY AND FULL-TIME EXEMPT STAFF COMPLETE AN ANNUAL REPORT ON OUTSIDE PROFESSIONAL ACTIVITIES (OPA), REGARDLESS OF WHETHER OR NOT THEY HAVE OUTSIDE PROFESSIONAL ACTIVITIES TO REPORT.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990, PART VII, SECTION A, LINE 1A, COLUMN (B)
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE FOLLOWING INDIVIDUALS LISTED ON FORM 990, PART VII, SECTION A, LINE 1A SPEND, ON AVERAGE, THE FOLLOWING HOURS PER WEEK DEVOTED TO THE DUTIES OF A RELATED ORGANIZATION: C. DANIEL MOTE, JR. 39 HOURS PER WEEK JOHN R. TOWNSHEND 39 HOURS PER WEEK DENNIS H. WOOD 38 HOURS PER WEEK NARIMAN FARVARDIN 39 HOURS PER WEEK ANN G. WYLIE 39 HOURS PER WEEK ASHOK K. AGRAWALA 39 HOURS PER WEEK MICHELE GELFAND 39 HOURS PER WEEK JULIE K. PHELPS 39 HOURS PER WEEK EDWARD C. WASKIEWICZ 37 HOURS PER WEEK CYNTHIA HALE 39 HOURS PER WEEK

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: PART VII, SECTION A, LINE 1A, COL (F) AND SCHEDULE J, PART II
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: OTHER COMPENSATION RECEIVED FROM A RELATED PARTY IS NOT READILY AVAILABLE FOR CERTAIN INDIVIDUALS INCLUDED IN PART VII, SECTION A OF THE RETURN. THE RELATED ORGANIZATION IS NOT REQUIRED TO FILE FORM 990. THE INFORMATION IN THIS SECTION IS INCOMPLETE AS A RESULT.
THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF URCI OVERSEES THE AUDIT AND THE SELECTION OF THE AUDIT FIRM. THE PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.
